sentences.english: In the East, similar characters were not very uncommon among eunuchs.
sentences.chinese: 在東方，在宦官羣體中，這種人物也並不罕見。

sentences.english: Generally speaking, eunuchs in the Ming dynasty believed in Buddhism and had countless contacts with Buddhist monks.
sentences.chinese: 明代宦官普遍信奉，與佛教僧團也有廣泛的交往結納。

sentences.english: Chen Quan requested eunuch to put him.
Eunuchs for impeachment after being exiled Shuofang.
sentences.chinese: 後因彈劾宦官，被流放朔方。

sentences.english: Ming Kenso years, eunuch excesses, killing Xian Chen.
sentences.chinese: 明憲宗年間，宦官弄權，濫殺賢臣。

sentences.english: Other figures in the temple include four eunuchs and a few female servants in men's clothes.
sentences.chinese: 殿內的彩塑侍從人物，有四名宦官及幾名男裝侍女。

sentences.english: As servants she had eunuchs of advanced age and but very few maidens.
sentences.chinese: 她身邊的僕人，多數是年老的宦官，極少有侍女。

sentences.english: The power of the eunuch had taken place great changes since An-shi Rebellion in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 唐代宦官的權勢經安史之亂髮生了重大的變化。

sentences.english: As we approached it two eunuchs came out to meet us.
sentences.chinese: 當我們臨近的時候，有兩個宦官出來相迎。

sentences.english: A castrated man employed as a harem attendant or as a functionary in certain Asian courts.
sentences.chinese: 宦官，太監某些亞洲宮廷內，在內宮侍候。

sentences.english: The Famen Temple, Chia Kuei is a trusted lackey of Liu Chin, a Ming Dynasty eunuch.
sentences.chinese: 賈桂是京劇《法門寺》裏明朝宦官劉瑾的親信奴才。

sentences.english: There were more eunuchs than anyone else in the Forbidden City.
sentences.chinese: 紫禁城宦官之多舉世獨步。

sentences.english: 13 Eunuchs and officials made up the largest army of ‘alchemists’ in the mid-Ming.
sentences.chinese: 明朝中葉，宦官和官僚構建了龐大的“方士”集團。

sentences.english: When the eunuchs saw me, their knees shook and they fell upon the ground in fear.
sentences.chinese: 而當宦官們見到我，則嚇得膝頭打顫，跌倒在地。

sentences.english: Tibetan Buddhism was praised highly during the period of Emperor Chengzu in Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 明代自成祖開始崇好藏傳佛教，宦官也因之深受影響。

sentences.english: Up to 3,000 orbited around the Son of Heaven like satellites.
sentences.chinese: 三千多名宦官如衆星捧月般圍繞着天子的周遭。

definition: Wei Zhongxian (1568-1627), infamous eunuch politician of late Ming
member of a monarch's inner ministerial circle (old)
imperial concubine or palace maid/imperial secretary (old)
Ten Permanent Functionaries at the end of Han, a byword for corruption
place at the imperial court, where emperor handled government affairs, gave orders etc
Li Linfu (-752), Tang politician, chancellor under Tang emperor Xuanzong 玄宗
